Piercings: I currently have: 00g lobes right side lip Still want: left side lip (my other one is perfectly positioned for snake bites) second right lobe tongue possibly left side nose (single or double) Tattoos: This would be a chest piece, from one shoulder to the other. I would be replacing the stupid looking hearts with classic birds, like the ones Kitty has on her shoulders. The flowers would be blue (forget-me-nots), and the leaves are green maple leaves, and inside the book will be written "How now, Spirit! Wither Wander You?" which is a line from Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream. I don't know what font I'd use, I'm still trying to figure that out. The tattoo is symbolic of my childhood: when there were maple trees and forget-me-nots in our front garden, when my mom had a glass blue bird on the kitchen windowsill, and when A Midsummer Night's Dream was my favourite Shakespeare play (I still love it, but it isn't my favourite one anymore) I've already put this one in my older post, but I thought I'd put the phoenix in again. I would change the head slightly, so that the neck curves upward in a more triumphant pose, with a small crest on its head. This would be a back piece, the wings framing my left shoulder blade and the tail dropping all the way down to my tailbone. I would be getting it in colour, with a red/orange gradient with the very edges being purplely. This tattoo is a symbol of compassion/forgiveness/new chances at life, the belief that you may have to burn but you can always begin again and leave your ashes behind you. I am getting this, hopefully at the end of this summer, on my right thigh. The whole lyric is "Things have changed for me, and that's okay" and it's from Panic! At the Disco. It basically is a reminder to myself that it's okay to not know what's going to happen to you years and years in the future, that it's okay to just live in the moment and be open to change. Another one I want to get I'm not sure where I'll get it, probably on my left shoulder/wrapped around my upper arm/bicep, and it will be a golden snitch that is a mix between these two designs: The pattern on the ball of this image and the wings and positioning (i.e. facing forward with wings stretched out) of the bottom snitch in this image, except the top part of the wing would be perfectly curved and not have that stupid looking dip thing The ball would have outlines in darker yellow/gold, and the body in a lighter yellow/gold. The wings would be outlined in either black of a lighter blue, with white ink inside the wings because white ink is awesome. Across the top, running along atop the wings and ball would be "I solemnly swear I am up to no good" and under the ball would be "mischief managed". I actually would ideally like to get this as a tramp stamp, but I'm not sure how that'd work with the phoenix tail. Harry Potter, and in particular HP fanfiction has played a huge part in my life, and was basically all that kept me sane and not suicidal through high school and the years of isolation caused by somewhat negligent parents and having crippling social anxieties that are directly in conflict with being an extrovert who NEEDS to be around people. Somewhere, not sure where, I want to get a small "DFTBA" tattoo. It stands for "Don't Forget to be Awesome", which whether or not I am still in the community it comes from, the Nerdfighter community, it's still a message I will always want with me. I would also want to get a very, very simple Labrys on my inner right ankle, which for me symbolizes both my love for the ancient cultures it was used in and also the feminism/LGBTQ bent that it has taken in modern times. Wiki page about the Labrys It would just be an outline, nothing fancy. Like so, except less janky looking: And finally, I would want to get one of these designs done on my inner left ankle. The patterns all hide a bass clef inside of them. Music has played such a huge part in my life, and bass clef is a better representation of me because of having been a cellist for so long. I'm still not sure which of these designs I would use, but definitely one of them.

Hey All,

I'm listening to the audio book for Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone in preparation for/celebration of Pottermore, and there's a few things which don't make sense. I decided to point them out, and then try and give explanations if I can think of some.


1. Why doesn't McGonagall seem to recognize Dumbledore's lemon drops in the first wizard scene of the book, when they're portrayed as a constant in the books, and Dumbledore doesn't seem to have just discovered them?

Possible Answer: ???

2. How does Tom, and the other wizards who say hi to him on the street while he's still with the Dursleys, recognize Harry when he's been out of circulation since he was a baby? Especially when Draco and the Weasleys don't recognize him?

Possible Answer: Simply a matter of whether or not his scar was showing?

3. How does Hagrid do wordless magic without specific wand motions when he was expelled after 3rd year?

Possible Answer: ??? 

4. How does Hagrid disappear in a blink of an eye when he puts harry on the train back to the Dursleys?

Possible Answer: He apparated. However, this doesn't make sense. Even if he is allowed to use some magic to deal with picking up/helping out Harry, he wouldn't have been allowed to get an apparating license if he'd been expelled for (SPOILER) killing someone (Moaning Myrtle) (even if he didn't actually do that, we don't know that yet.

5. How come Dumbledore didn't realize that Quirell was possessed by Voldemort when he came back from his sabbatical? The way Hagrid describes it to Harry, it sounds like Quirell had been teaching again for a while before Harry got there. It would seem that Dumbledore would at the very least be seriously concerned if one of his long-time professors suddenly became rather squirrely.

Possible Answer: ???

6. It's unlikely that there are so many phoenixes, unicorns, and dragons in the world for each one to give something for a wand only once, so why is it that the whole brother-wands-can't-fight-each-other seems like such a new and weird thing?

If any of you can think of any answers I haven't figured out, or can think of other questions I missed, feel free to comment!

Urgh. I've been being...clingy. For lack of a better word. I want to touch her, hold her...kiss her. I want to sidle forward when she is smoking her clove, grasp her hips to mine, slide my hands up the curves of her sides, smiling a besotted smile while I kiss her lips once, twice, lingering. Her nose brushing mine. I know she doesn't feel this way, and that she doesn't welcome the attention.

Maybe I'm being selfish. Maybe I'm being self-centered and inconsiderate by being incredibly, unspeakably hurt by the current situation in my life. I like to think I try really, really hard to make people happy, to be there for my friends when they need me. At least I like to think that. I'd gotten that impression from being called a Saint and a Llama Herder so many times.

One of my greatest fears has always been being not wanted. Not even abandonment, exactly, because it's a fear that stems from being a child, sitting at the top of the slide at the back of the playground singing to myself because no one wanted to play with me. I want to be wanted, or at least for it to matter if I'm not there, for people to notice, people to care, people to want me to be around. I try really hard to give people reasons to keep me around.

I feel like I'm being like Bl saying that I'm hurt that one mistake seems to be enough to negate how hard I've tried to be a good friend. But I can't put it into words that sound less self-aggrandizing. I've said many times that I wouldn't know what to do without A in my life. And I don't. I'm falling apart. It sounds stupid, that getting the cold shoulder from a friend can make me cry myself to sleep some nights. But it does. But I don't know what to do. I tried to apologize, but I'll be honest, I didn't do a very good job of it because I was/am angry at A for the aggressive behavior, having been given a cold shoulder before I even know what I'd done to deserve it. I understand a little now why, but that still doesn't make it feel like that should be okay with me. I feel like I should stand up for myself, that it should be okay for me to let her know that she hurt me. But at this point I don't want to. I'm sorry. I just want to stop feeling like I'm worthless, I want my bb back.

Personal Analysis: If I were ever to tell Kitty how I felt, I feel like this song would exactly describe the situation. There would be pain in my voice when I told her, because this can be painful at times, as evidenced by the fact that I cried for three hours straight after discovering this song. Also, I have the fear that the current closeness we share would have to go, by her decision, because it's not healthy or fair to me. She'd do it for my own good, I guess. No hard feelings about it, just she's not going to indulge me in hurting myself over her. I would say "I love you" to her, and I probably would touch her affectionately, as I do on a regular basis, including putting my hand around her waist. I don't think she would run away completely (as is one of my greatest fears associated with the situation of her finding out that I'm in love with her, and that I don't just love her), but she would definitely be firm in that I can't cling to her/hold on to her. I think while she would never admit it, there would be at least some ambiguous feelings on her part on the situation. Also, I don't think Kitty actually knows what love is, not the kind that I feel for her. That might be horrible of me or I might just not know about it if she does/has experienced that kind of love, but I don't think she really understand what love means, at least in this sense. I would be scared to breathe, afraid of the consequences of telling her. Because she does love me, even though not in the way I wish she would, she would probably comfort me, especially if I cried. If we were doing something which she at some point realized was probably too intimate/romantic she would leave (that particular situation, not in general), and I would probably be hurt and protest, asking her why the fact that I told her had to change how we interacted with one another. I can dance with her, I can spend all my time with her, but I can't touch her, claim her as mine, she would enforce that distance (in as nice a way as possible, but enforce it regardless). She wouldn't hold it against me, and wouldn't reject me because she understands that feelings aren't something we can always control and that everyone needs to be loved. There's no way she could fail to notice the manifestations of how I love her, especially after I had told her that I was in love with her, but she doesn't feel that way. Apologetic, but won't change how she feels because she just doesn't feel that way about me. I think that aspect is what made me cry. The part of this song/situation that is so sad is that it isn't horrendously sad. She understands, and wouldn't cast me aside or be horrible to me. But it's just never going to be that way between us, period, and there's nothing that can be done about it. It's the hopelessness of the situation, while at the same time not being something that can healed. You have to be hurt, actually grievously injured before you can heal from that hurt, but if there's never an actual hurt to heal, the hopelessness just remains, the situation in stasis just short of what is desired.

There was this kid in the Fourth grade named Justin Stern who I had the silliest crush on, and I sent him a "valentine gram" on valentine's day. I was very nervous about doing so, so I even disguised my handwriting as best I could. He still managed to figure it out.

Now, this wouldn't have been so bad, even if he had been...well, a fourth grade boy who thought all girls had cooties. But not only did he figure out that the valentine was from me, he proceeded to announce that I had sent it to him, read it aloud to the entire class, and got the entire lot of them (including my so-called friends) to laugh at me until I fled the classroom.

I have never been the one to make the first move with anyone since, and have really nasty rejection issues. This has continued to be an issue up into present day, where I find it really hard to 1)tell people how I feel about them, 2)trust people to not cast me aside automatically if they don't feel the same as I do, or 3)be able to handle it maturely when someone I care about rejects my affection (whether that affection happens to be sexual or platonic).

I even lied the first time my first boyfriend DJ asked if I liked him, and ended up waiting a whole 'nother year before we got together.

Not that it has any direct relevance, but for the sake of a time line, I'll mention I started homeschooling again after that year. I'd started homeschooling halfway through the third grade, but had fought with my mother so much she sent me back to public school halfway through the fourth grade. I resolved to figure out some way to get along with my mother no matter what after that because with the combination of the teasing, back-stabbing/catty friendships, and then finally the thing with Justin, there was no fucking way I was going to stick around in public school.</lj-cut>

An antique shop lives in the alley behind the library, and the windows are streaked with dirt and an “out of business” sign hangs listlessly in the window. You, a brave soul, venture beyond the stiff book bindings of the library to the shop, and a small bell above the door chimes quietly, the sound strangely muffled by the patchwork quilts draped over the more precious pieces inside. Everything seems faded, veiled by dust which has settled over everything like snow, deeper in some places than others but blanketing every surface regardless. Single tea cups sit with their saucers, the sunny yellow of hand-painted buttercups a powdered ochre upon a small table, the Cherry wood marred by scratches and scribbles from children wielding permanent markers. A rusty red leather case filled with faded photos, scraps of paper with unrelated notes tucked into the pockets, and a tiny lock and key on a chain is tucked in with the teddy bears and a tatty baby blanket. Beside it on the shelf, a little ways off from the other toys lays a clown doll, broken strains of music drifting out to the ear as the string inside pulls tight again, every so often missing a note where the teeth of the movement have been broken off inside the clown’s head, which is slightly flattened on one side. Wandering through the shelves into the depths of the shop you come across one shelf that is different from the others. In the dust lays the perfect outline of a heart, as if it had been removed so recently there hadn’t been time for the dust to creep in and age its clarity. Next to it on that otherwise empty shelf sits a box, a small indescript box tapped shut with brown packing tape and tied like a bakery box with soft looking twine. You reach out your hand to stroke the contours of the box, to feel the softened edges of cardboard corners that have lived to long, to sympathize with the fibers of the rough brown tape, to smile wryly at the inevitable fraying at the ends of the twine. The desire to give in to curiosity is strong and you have just begun to pull at the string in earnest when another presence makes itself know. A woman, with eyes as old and sad as the ancient earth stands with a regretful smile on her face, leaning on the broom which does not stir the dust. She says, “I gave my heart out To a girl who picked it up and played with it like a glass paperweight that caught her eye before discarding it, Where it lay forgotten under the floor boards, struggling to be seen under handwritten pages, suffocating in the heavy moments, choking on the dry rasp of ink. Eventually the delicate hand-blown glass bauble made its way back to me, returned when it found no use to her heartless life. So precious it was, I cradled it in my hands and cried with joy, but it still is stained and clouded with sorrow for chances lost. Now I’m saving it, Wrapped up in a box with newspaper and twine for a man who promised me to take care of it, its been set aside on the shelf you see, safe in the knowledge that one day it will be his and his will be mine, sharing the same abuse yet swirling In a symphony of different colors beneath the surface to create on overall harmony. It’s true, I sometimes wonder If his words are sort of like those promises made in the War by young boy-soldiers, Men who’ve left dark-skinned forgotten women wrapped in tattered silks still waiting on lost, lonely islands in the Pacific, But each day I pull at the strings of the box that holds it and set it on the shelf again open to the world "for sale", I remember his smile, his soft fingertips curled around his own precious glass, offering me the currents of love trapped inside despite the livid scar across its surface. And then I cry for his loss and his hope and set aside my own heart once more. So I’m sorry, But I haven’t anything left for you, To buy or barter or steal or what have you. I’m afraid you’ll have to try your luck elsewhere.” And as you leave, the saddened bell above the door rings softly and the dust seems to whisper a
goodbye.

Okay, so this is completely unedited, and totally random for anyone else, but I thought I'd chuck it out into the universe. This will possibly--MAYBE-- go into the Mpreg that I'm supposedly writing, but never work on...

Anyway, it was inspired by a picture on Deviant Art which I have since lost. It was Severus outside the Gryff common room, asleep on the floor, holding a lily, determined to stay there all night if he had to so he could get his chance to apologize to lily for calling her a mudblood.

“Severus. Severus! For heaven’s sake, get up you great greasy bat of a man!” Philius sneered as the man in question sat up, hair in disarray, glowering at the painting. “What is it, Philius, that is so urgent that you must deprive me of the precious little sleep I get?” Philius’ lip curled into a nasty smile as he answered, “A student. There’s a student outside in the hall, been there for hours. Not a slytherin, either. Though you might like to know.” Severus fought the urge to pinch the bridge of his nose as he smoothed out his hair and pulled on his dressing gown. Sighing, he asked, “Who is it, Philius?” If possible, the portrait’s smirk grew even crueler. “Why, I’m sure you know him, Severus. It’s Harry Potter.” Severus Snape let out a vicious, wordless snarl of rage, stalking to the door and throwing it open. “Potter!” he barked, “Come to humiliate me further? I should have known you would be just like your father, you arrogant…” Severus’ voice trailed off, his anger receding at the sight before him, guilt welling up in its place. Damn the boy. Damn him. Curled up against the cold stone wall outside his door, the Potter boy lay, obviously asleep. His young face was streaked with tears that were just beginning to dry, and it sounded as if he was having trouble breathing. How long had it been since Severus had seen the boy cry? He wasn’t sure he ever had. Even when Potter’s precious mutt died, the boy had not cried. Shaking off this disturbing thought, Severus noted how the boy shivered, half wrapped in his invisibility cloak. As he was staring at Harry’s—no, Potter’s—sleeping form, Severus’ eyes were drawn to something in the boy’s hand. Clutched against the boy’s chest was a lily. Or at least, he assumed it was a lily. It wasn’t very much of it at this point, nothing left but the stamen and two bruised, torn petals attached to a stem, but Severus’ heart still clenched at the sight, gasping quietly in pain and surprise. Damn him for giving the boy his memories! But Severus was unable to ignore the memory that floated to the surface, of a young man, also in tears, clutching a similar flower to his own chest, shivering outside the gryffindor common room, determined to sleep the night out there if that was needed for him to be able to apologize to Lily. Severus couldn’t ignore the plea behind Potter’s action, the appeal to his conscience. Steeling himself, he bent down and roughly shook the boy’s shoulder before quickly stepping back, setting his face into a blank mask of indifference. Potter started awake, looking around wildly before his eyes settled on Severus, towering over him in the door way. A gleam of cautious hope appeared in the boy’s eye, and Severus had to look away to keep himself from giving in to that hope. “For heaven’s sake, you imbecile, get inside before someone sees you!” he snapped, waving the child through the door as he scrambled off of the floor, tangled in that infernal cloak of his. Once inside his sitting room, Severus pointed to the couch, and imperiously ordered, “Sit.” To his surprise, Potter followed his instruction, curling up in his usual corner, looking rather self-conscious. Severus left him to surreptitiously wipe the tears off his face, soon returning with two mugs of hot chocolate. Setting his own down on the coffee table, he thrust the other into Potter’s hands, saying shortly, “Drink that, and then you will immediately return to your dorm.” But as he attempted to step away, Potter grabbed hold of his wrist. “Severus,” he pleaded, setting his mug down next to Severus’ with his other hand, “please.” Severus stiffened at the familiar hand on his arm, but did not respond, staring blankly at a spot high above potter’s head. Sighing, Harry slipped off the couch onto his feet in front of the other man’s feet, resting his head against Severus’ thigh.


This was his only chance, Harry knew, to get through to his lover. “Please, Severus, just listen. If…if you still don’t want me after that, I’ll leave. I won’t--” Harry’s voice cracked and he cleared his throat, “bother you again. But let me explain.” He waited, holding his breath, for Severus’ answer. When none came, Harry’s heart sunk, but he plowed on anyway, pretending that his lover’s silence was an indication that he was willing to listen. “I…I hadn’t seen any of them for so long, Severus. What with the war, and classes, and my all ways down here training with you, I just hadn’t seen any of them in forever. It was just supposed to be a friendly get-together down at the Three Broomsticks, a couple of drinks between friends…” Harry’s voice trailed off despairingly at this point, before he took a deep breath and shouldered on, trying to hold the tears back. “We were having such a great time, and I warned them that I really should be getting back, because I had promised you I wouldn’t be out too late. Everyone protested, and Ginny insisted that I stayed for just one last round, on her. I gave in, and she marched up to the bar and got us all another butter beer. I didn’t notice anything wrong with it at all. It wasn’t until later, when I…well, after that started that Hermione got suspicious and confiscated my drink. She…She p-put something in my drink, Severus. G-g-gin g-gave me ____________.” Harry gave into his tears and sobbed quietly against Severus’ knee. “I’m s-so s-sorry Severus, p-please, please, forgive me! I d-didn’t m-mean t-to!” unable to continue, Harry just clung to Severus’ trouser leg desperately, hoping that his love would understand.


Only Severus’ years as a spy enabled him to remain impassive through Harry’s tale. So this is what the Weasley chit meant, he thought. “Get what’s mine”, indeed. He would plan his revenge against the girl in good time. For now, he had a sobbing Potter to deal with. Part of him wanted to wrap Potter in his arms and sweep him into his bedroom, making slow, sweet love to the distraught young man and kiss those tears away, but the other, more responsible part of him knew he had to take this chance to set the boy free. Better let him go now, while he was still in control, than wait until Harry realized what an old, withered, shell of a man his partner was, and started straying away from him. “Some things cannot be forgiven.” Severus said in a voice devoid of emotion as he stepped out of the boy’s strong grasp. Turning on his heel, Severus said coldly,“ Good night, Mr. Potter.” And swept into his bedroom, slamming the door behind him.
